tr.td:
Oncology Program / Programme d'oncologie
Diagnosis – Post Nephroblastoma

td.b: Staging and treatment plan confirmed by:

ul.li: Clear cell sarcoma of the kidney

b.small: *SIOP Staging of Nephroblastoma:based upon surgical evaluation after administration of chemotherapy to reduce the size of the tumor

ul.li: Tumor is fully resected and is limited to the kidney, or if outside the kidney, it is surrounded with a fibrous pseudocapsule. Tumor may be found in the renal capsule, pelvic system (but not involving the ureter walls), and intrarenal vessels. There is no evidence of renal sinus vessel involvement or tumor at or beyond the margins of resection

Tumor extends beyond the kidney or fibrous pseudocapsule but is completely resected without evidence of tumor at or beyond the margins of resection. Tumor infiltrates, which are completely resected, can extend into the renal sinus, blood vessels and lymph nodes beyond the renal parenchyma, adjacent organs, or vena cava.

After surgery, residual tumor remains but is confined to the abdomen. This includes regional lymph node involvement, incomplete resection of the tumor, tumor penetration of the peritoneal surface, tumor thrombi of vessels at resection margins, tumor spillage, or previous biopsy. There is no evidence of hematogenous metastasis.
Hematogenous metastasis (e.g. lung, liver, bone, brain) or lymph node involvement beyond the abdominopelvic region.
Bilateral renal involvement is present at the time of diagnosis.

td.small:
SIOP=International Society of Pediatric Oncology
Vujanić, G. M., & Sandstedt, B. (2010). The pathology of Wilms’ tumour (nephroblastoma): the International Society of Paediatric Oncology approach.
Journal of clinical pathology, 63(2), 102–9. doi:10.1136/jcp.2009.064600
Israels, T., Moreira, C., Scanlan, T., Molyneux, L., Kampondeni, S., Hesseling, P., ... Borgstein, E. (2013). SIOP PODC : Clinical Guidelines for the
Management of Children With Wilms Tumour in a Low Income Setting. Pediatric Blood Cancer, (60).

td.strong:
Oncology Program / Programme d'oncologie
Diagnosis – Staging – Treatment Plan

tr.th: This is a follow-up DST for (select reason):

td.small: (Include a copy of operative report in chart, if applicable)
(include a copy of pathology report in chart, if applicable)

ul.li: Clear cell sarcoma of the kidney

span.small: *SIOP Staging of Nephroblastoma:based upon surgical evaluation after administration of chemotherapy to reduce the size of the tumor

ul.li: I Tumor is fully resected and is limited to the kidney, or if outside the kidney, it is surrounded with a fibrous pseudocapsule. Tumor may be found in the renal capsule, pelvic system (but not involving the ureter walls), and intrarenal vessels. There is no evidence of renal sinus vessel involvement or tumor at or beyond the margins of resection.

II Tumor extends beyond the kidney or fibrous pseudocapsule but is completely resected without evidence of tumor at or beyond the margins of resection. Tumor infiltrates, which are completely resected, can extend into the renal sinus, blood vessels and lymph nodes beyond the renal parenchyma, adjacent organs, or vena cava.

III After surgery, residual tumor remains but is confined to the abdomen. This includes regional lymph node involvement, incomplete resection of the tumor, tumor penetration of the peritoneal surface, tumor thrombi of vessels at resection margins, tumor spillage, or previous biopsy. There is no evidence of hematogenous metastasis.
IV Hematogenous metastasis (e.g. lung, liver, bone, brain) or lymph node involvement beyond the abdominopelvic region.
V Bilateral renal involvement is present at the time of diagnosis.

span.small:
SIOP=International Society of Pediatric Oncology
Vujanić, G. M., & Sandstedt, B. (2010). The pathology of Wilms’ tumour (nephroblastoma): the International Society of Paediatric Oncology approach.
Journal of clinical pathology, 63(2), 102–9. doi:10.1136/jcp.2009.064600
Israels, T., Moreira, C., Scanlan, T., Molyneux, L., Kampondeni, S., Hesseling, P., ... Borgstein, E. (2013). SIOP PODC : Clinical Guidelines for the
Management of Children With Wilms Tumour in a Low Income Setting. Pediatric Blood Cancer, (60).
